STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 29, 2020
Kara Mularz
Ogemaw/Roscommon County DHHS
444 E Houghton
West Branch, MI 48661
RE: License #: CP650201338
Ogemaw/Roscommon County DHHS
444 E Houghton
West Branch, MI 48661
Dear Mrs. Mularz:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on September
8-14, 2020 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract
and Modified Settlement Agreement (MSA) requirements, a written corrective action plan
is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of
the MSA and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Venus M. Decker, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(248) 639-9585
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
INTERIM INSPECTION REPORT

Services

West Branch, MI 48661

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record
containing all of the following documents:
(f) Documentation that the foster parent has received
orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency.
Three borrowed homes were reviewed. One out of three homes
did not have documentation that the foster parent received
orientation before placement of child. The child was placed on
2/16/20, but the form was signed on 2/22/20.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in
the agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(c) Conduct a thorough investigation including all
necessary collateral contacts.
Four special evaluations were reviewed. One out of four
evaluations did not complete the assessment of the household
member, so it was unknown if he had the proper criminal checks
and central registry checks completed.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an
agency shall complete a written report that includes all of
the following information:
Four special evaluations were reviewed. Two out of four
evaluations did not have a report written within 15 days of the
4

conclusion of the investigation. One the verbal summary is
provided to the agency, the evaluation has been completed and
a report is to be completed within 15 days.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an
agency shall complete a written report that includes all of
the following information:
(b) Identification of the information source, unless
anonymous or confidential, as specified in the child
protection law, 1975 PA 238, MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Four special evaluations were reviewed. Two out of four
evaluations documented confidential information in the report.
DHHS Social Workers are not to be named in the contacts nor
are DHHS Social Workers interviews to be used within the body
of the licensing special evaluation report.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(a) Provide the foster parent with a copy of the report
required by subrule (5) of this rule within 10 calendar days
of its completion.
Four special evaluations were reviewed. One out of four
evaluations did not provide the report to the foster parent within
10 calendar days of completion.
R 400.12404 Placement.
(6) Before the placement of a child, the agency shall
document preparation, regardless of the child's age, that
explains all of the following to all relevant parties:
(a) The circumstances necessitating placement.
(b) The child’s individual needs.
5

(c) Any special problems presented.
Six foster care files were reviewed. Two out of six files did not
have the above information documented.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the
child's record before a change of placement occurs:
(g) Information about the child was shared with the new
placement, consistent with the requirements of R
400.12417.
Six foster care files were reviewed. One out of six files did not
have information consistent with R 400.12417. This is usually
found on the DHS-3307 or other agency document.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(4) If an emergency change in placement is necessary, then
all of the documentation required in subrules (2) and (3) of
this rule shall be in the child's record within 14 calendar
days after the change in placement.
Six foster care files were reviewed. Two out of six files did not
have the necessary change of placement documentation. The
foster child was in a foster home and then placed in two
separate hospital settings in an emergency situation.
R 400.12417 Foster parent information.
(1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the
following information before the placement or replacement
of a child:
(b) Child's date of birth.
(c) Available known information about the child’s health.
(d) Any known history of abuse or neglect of the child.
(e) All known emotional and psychological factors relating
to the care of the child.
6

(f) All known behaviors of the child.
(g) Circumstances necessitating placement or replacement
of the child.
(h) Any other known information to enable the foster parent
to provide a stable, safe, and healthy environment for the
foster child and the foster family, including information
about siblings who do not reside in the foster home.
Six foster care files were reviewed. Two out of six files did not
have the above information documented as provided to the
foster parent before the placement of the child.
R 400.12417 Foster parent information.
(1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the
following information before the placement or replacement
of a child:
(j) Authorization to provide routine and emergency medical
care.
Six foster care files were reviewed. Two out of six files did not
have the above information documented as provided to the
foster parent before the placement of the child.
R 400.12418
Development of Service Plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
Six foster care files were reviewed. One out of six files had did
not have a service written in 30 calendar days from removal.
The report was due on 6/4/20 and was completed on 6/5/20.
R 400.12418 Development of Service Plans
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter
Six foster care files were reviewed. One out of six files had did
not have a service written in 90 calendar days. The report was
due on 1/23/20 and was completed on 1/25/20.
7

R 400. 12509 Independent living record
(g) Current documentation of financial support sufficient to
meet the youth's housing, clothing, food, and
miscellaneous expenses.
Two independent living records were reviewed. Two out of two
records did not have documentation that the youth was
receiving financial support to meets the youth’s needs.
R 400.12510 Independent living contract
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the youth
and the social service worker. The contract shall be
reviewed and updated at least once every 90 calendar days
and a copy provided to the youth.
Two independent living records were reviewed. One out of two
records did not have an updated contract signed.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MSA violation. Please note that there
are additional MSA requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional MSA requirements.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that there
are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in section
1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements
except for the following:
DHHS Policy 722-06B page 1-7 Family Team Meeting
Six foster care files were reviewed. One out of six did not have an FTM completed before
the service plan was due.
8

DHHS IL+ ILP Contract Oct 17: 1.1.b. Page 2 Program Requirements-Client
Eligibility Criteria-continuing eligibility Criteria-Ansell-Casey Life Skills
Assessment: Every 90 days, the youth shall be evaluated using the applicable
Casey Life Skills Assessment (CLSA) to determine continued eligibility/suitability
for placement. If the youth lacks sufficient progress to transition into general IL,
they will be considered eligible to remain in the ILP program. .
Two independent living files were reviewed. One out of two did not have the assessment
noted above completed.
IV. Analyst findings:
There are no safety concerns noted.
V. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
R. 400.12324 (2) (d): any issues or concerns from inside our outside sources during
an annual inspection must be resolved in the annual report. This resolution can be
placed in the section “assessment of the foster parents ability…”
R 400.12327 (1) (c): All additional findings in an investigation needs to be assessed,
verified and written accordingly in a special investigation report. If the additional
information does not result in a violation, the information does not need to be placed
in the report.
R 400.12421(1) (A): Visitation with parents should be documented in case notes. If
the parent does not attend the scheduled parenting session; there is to be a case
note documenting that.
R 400.12505 (2) (b): Worker should be noting in their monthly visitation that they
area verifying that the youth is managing their monthly expenditures and verifying this
as often as possible.
R 400.12506: Worker is to verify employment and/or school of the youth.
VI. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
Special Investigation writing.
VII. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during
this licensing period.
9

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
AND
The agency has not submitted corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
9/16/20
________________________________________
Venus M. Decker Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 29, 2020
________________________________________
Linda D. Tansil Date
Area Manager
